column4: Hi I'm trying to install a graphics card driver on my laptop using this URL, running into problems can anyone help me?
http://gadgetmix.com/index/sony-vaio-p-ubuntu-9-04s-problems-and-how-to-solve-them/
Also would this work on 10.04 or have the commands changed?
whats the graphics card? ATI?
I think it is Intel GMA 500
Its running pretty slowly though and I've read lots of things (like that URL) that say its not that great until you install this particular driver
whats the spec of the laptop?
Its a 1.6ghz intel atom 2gb RAM Sony Vaio P
Its running slow, (When scrolling in firefox) in a similar way to if you installed windows and didn't install thelatest drivers
Thanks, I think I'm stuck at the gpg commands. But I don't know if that repository is good for 10.04 (Because it says jaunty)
you'll need to change the repo to say lucid instead of jaunty
Thanks I'll try that
np mate, let me know if it doesn't work
that;s the error you get when you paste the command in?
step 4 and 5 are importing the appropriate gpg keys to authenticate with the respositories, it may be that since Lucid is only JUST released, those repos may not exist yet
have you tried searching a little harder for a how-to for Lucid instead? You may find it by searching for the chipset rather than the laptop model
I have and haven't found much, I'll take a look now (but cause lucid is so new there isn't much)
here you go http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1330751
hmmmmmmmmm doesn't actually fix the problem though
ok going to go for that thanks for your help! First time use of linux has been a fun experience :D!
Shame though, I really like the 10.04 purple
I did it the other week at work because I liked it so much when I installed a 10.04 Beta VM

your best bet is boot up with a gparted live cd, delete your linux partitions and then boot up with a Karmic live cd and choose the option to install side by side, not positive what that will do with grub though
